#summary Learning Blender

|| Updated to *BlenderFDS 2.0*. ||

The Blender windowing system is a treat. It looks like some sort of space-ship control panel and you have never seen anything like it. The learning curve can be steep, and new users can be discouraged at first.

Once you learn it, however, you'll wish all your programs worked this way.

The following is a short list of educational resources for Blender. Many of these resources are dedicated to _Blender 2.49_, and are currently being transitioned to the _Blender 2.6x series_. The transition will take some time.

<wiki:toc max_depth="2" />

----

= Some starting points =

This is the best starting point I could find. Here are some introductory screencasts on Blender 2.5:

 * [http://www.blendercookie.com/getting-started-with-blender-modeling/]

Here are two blog entries from Yorik van Havre blog. These are general but step-by-step introductions to quick architecture modeling with Blender.

 * [http://yorik.uncreated.net/tutorials/architecture-blender.html]
 * [http://yorik.uncreated.net/tutorials/precisionmodelling-blender.html]
